meanings.definition: A person or thing that slits.
meanings.sent1: The slitter carefully cut the paper into strips.
meanings.sent2: The factory purchased a new slitter to help with the packaging process.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat acted like a slitter, shredding the curtains with its claws.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp wit was like a slitter, cutting through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The slitter's precision was unmatched, creating perfect slices every time.

meanings.sent1: The slitter in the textile factory worked tirelessly to cut the fabric.
meanings.sent2: The industrial slitter was used to divide the large rolls of paper into smaller sections.
meanings.sent3: The slitter in the workshop hummed happily as it sliced through the metal sheets.
meanings.sent4: The slitter's blades danced gracefully, transforming the material into precise strips.
meanings.sent5: The loud hum of the slitter filled the room as it efficiently cut through the plastic.

meanings.definition: To cut or tear into narrow strips or pieces.
meanings.sent1: She used the knife to slitter the paper into thin strips.
meanings.sent2: The chef needed to slitter the vegetables for the stir-fry dish.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to slitter the old magazines to make colorful confetti.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to slitter through the trees, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The scissors were sharp enough to slitter the fabric with ease.
